<div id="center">$T[-Somewhere in Europe-]</div> The trip takes longer than expected. At least it feels much longer. You’re 22 years old, fresh out of a Bachelor’s degree in Corporate Communication, whatever that’s supposed to mean, and you’re almost broke. An airplane ticket is out of the question. So you take the bus to London, where you catch the Eurostar to Paris; it’s crowded and not particularly comfortable; you have to wait a couple of hours in Paris before catching the international train from Gare de Lyon, where you settle in a comfortable position in your third-class seat. You feel a little anxious, but hopeful that something better is waiting for you out there. Something new. (display:"goto")[[Prepare for the long ride->Prepare for the long ride.]](set: $time to "21:45")(set: $hour to 21)(set: $minute to 45) (set: $money to 80)<div id="center">$T[-Somewhere in Europe-]</div> $A[Why did I decide to do this anyways?] It certainly wasn’t the money, though your bank account could appreciate every little bit it can get. “You’ll see the world and become wiser!” your mum said. “You’ll nail some hot Romanian chicks!” argued your friends. "I'll finally have time to work on my book!" you said to yourself. You bought into those arguments and now here you are, ready for an adventure. The train takes several days as it chugs its way through the green fields of eastern France, the small villages in the mountains of Germany and the hills of Austria, filled with more wind turbines and farms than you thought possible. You stop every now and then, get off at some station where you have a coffee and a sandwich while you chat to some random people, waiting for your next train relay. As you go farther East the locals speak less and less English and the polite Germanic accents are replaced with friendly but confused Slavic tones. You smile and nod, trying to remember some of the words. $A[After all, this is what it’s all about, right?] $prot[($nTask: "New task: Arrive at The Crooked Elm")] (display:"goto")[[Continue journey->get off.]](set: $day to "Friday")(set: $time to "9:20")(set: $hour to 9)(set: $minute to 20)<div id="center">$T[-Somewhere in Europe-]</div> The final train drops you off at Timisoara, a big city in western Romania. From there you take another bus to Lugoj, but after that things get harder. You have to get to a village that’s so small it’s not even on the map. You spend the night at a cheap hotel then convince one of the locals to give you a ride in exchange for what little you have left in your wallet. $I[You lost 80£] He drives silently as you follow the river Timish deeper into the mountains. The road is steep and perilous and in progressively worse condition the further away you go. You begin to wonder if you haven't fallen victim to some scam, the big country man next to you driving towards a secluded location... Before you have too much time to dwell on these thoughts, you spot a handful of rooftops nested among the trees. (display:"goto")[[Arrive at the village]](set: $day to "Saturday")(set: $hour to 15)(set: $minute to 50) (set: $money to 0)<div id="center">$T[-Somewhere in Romania-]</div> In any case, you arrive at //a village//. $a['Am I at the right place?'] you ask the man, but he shrugs, takes a few paces around the car to stretch his legs, then gets back in and drives off. You look around - there is a road sign with a name, but it's broken, half of it missing and the edge charred as if struck by lightning. Even on the remaining part the paint is so old that you can’t really make out any of the letters. Still, this has to be it - there are no other villages nearby. The village itself is very small - a main street and a few clusters of stone houses, few dozens at best. The mountain air is clean and fresh, filling your nostrils with the scent of old pines and green moss. Save for a few electric lamps barely illuminating the street, it doesn’t look very modern. Judging by the architectural style, it hasn't moved in the last few centuries. $A[Old and authentic, no technological distractions... this could be good for writing and inspiration. I'm sure there are lots of legends and folklore to get out of the locals, if I ask them nicely...] You notice a congregation of buildings that’s bound to be the main square. (display:"goto")[[Head to the village center]] (set: $time to "17:30")(set: $hour to 17)(set: $minute to 30)<div id="center">$vil</div> There isn't much here and you feel somewhat lost. $a[‘Excuse me, I’m looking for… “The Crooked Elm” hotel. It’s in this village…’] In your best Romanian you address a passerby, a man in his forties wearing a respectable however old-fashioned suit. Along with your explanation you vaguely gesture around, hoping that you don’t sound too ridiculous. Given how few houses there are it’s somewhat embarrassing that you haven’t found the place yourself. ‘The residence is located outside of town’ he replies, surprising you with his flawless English and deep, suave voice. ‘Head down the main road this way - there is a small torrent that later joins into the river. Follow the path upstream, towards the mountains, and you shall find it in about an hour.’ $a[‘An hour!’] you exclaim. Just when you thought your journey was over. (display:"goto")[[Peer towards the mountainside]] (set: $time to "18:00")(set: $hour to 18)(set: $minute to 0) (set: $timeStarted to true)<div id="center">$mount</div> You can make out the road the gentleman is talking about and even if you haven’t brought much luggage with you the thought of carrying your bags uphill for an hour disheartens you. $a[‘Isn’t there some sort of transportation?’] You turn around, but the man is gone. In fact there isn’t anyone else around - if you didn’t know any better, you would have said that the village was deserted. The trees rustle in the wind. It’s only 6 p.m. but the village is on an eastern slope and with the sun blocked behind the tall ridges, the world is already sinking in velvet shadows. You sigh. (display:"goto")(link-reveal-goto:"Head towards the hotel on foot")[(set: $hour to 19)(set: $time to "19:00")]<div id="center">$mount</div> After what seems like an eternity of back pain and sweating along the old stony path, the trees thin out on the left and you see a tall ornate gate with metal bars, surrounded by a sturdy iron fence. $I[ [ ]<obs| ] (display:"eye")(link-repeat:"Examine the gate")[(replace:?obs)[It appears to be hand forged and pretty solid, despite its state. There is a lock in the middle and two stone pillars on each side, decorated with stone gargoyles. You try to push it but it won't open, the metal only rattling ominously. You get the feeling that the statues are staring at you disapprovingly.]] (display:"eye")(link-repeat:"Examine the fence")[(replace:?obs)[It's old and rusty, but still pretty solid. The spaces between the bars are too thin for you to squeeze through. You briefly consider jumping over it, but the bars have spikes on top and you wouldn't risk getting injured on an old rusty edge so far away from a hospital.] ] (display:"goto")[[Look for a way to open the gate]]<div id="center">$mount</div> Behind you can make out a large grey manor built into the hillside. <div id="center"><img src="images/tr/environments/mansion.png" width="1200" align="center"></div> It’s several stories high, a central part and two wings with several towers and balconies looming over the mournful garden. It’s hard to make out everything in the darkness, but you estimate it has at least two dozen guest rooms, perhaps more. $A[Wow... the place must have been a real luxury resort back in the day, perhaps then the village was a popular tourist destination? A shame, now it reeks of disuse and decay... Could be a cool place to stay, but I doubt they get many visitors. On the bright side, my job as a receptionist is probably going to be a whole lot of sitting around, waiting and doing nothing. Perhaps I could go back down to the village and find a pub, befriend the locals? Or maybe get back to that book I've always wanted to write?] A thought for later. For now, you should just move in. <div id="center">$mount</div> [There doesn't seem to be any button attached to the gate, only a small brass doorbell with a string attached to it. It appears highly unlikely that anyone would be able to hear it all the way from here to the mansion.]<main| (display:"goto")(link-repeat:"Shout")[(replace:?main)[(display:"Shout")]] (display:"goto")(link-repeat:"Try to call the hotel through your phone")[(replace:?main)[(display:"Try to call the hotel through your phone")]] (display:"goto")[[Ring the doorbell]] $a['Hellooooo? Anybody? I'm locked out here!!'] You yell a couple more times, but nothing happens. You pace in front of the gate as the minutes pass. A few of the windows are lit up, which calms you somewhat, but clearly they can't hear you from here.<div id="center">$mount</div> You pull the string and the bell rings with a faint and hollow sound. Instinctively, you step back without knowing why. After a few seconds, the (link-reveal:"gate creaks open.")[ $A[What is this, a hidden mechanism, or some sort of an elaborate joke? Would they go to such lengths just to create the illusion of a haunted house? Maybe it's good for their business, but still... I'll have to come back and figure it out later.] Your back aches too much right now and even if there were a few hidden wires somewhere, you probably wouldn't be able to see them in the darkness anyways. (display:"goto")[[Take the path to the manor]](set: $time to "19:30")(set: $minute to 30) (change: ?page,(bg:"https://xfiction.org/images/tr/environments/gate_open.jpg")) ]You take out your phone and attempt to call the manager - you were given a number following your online job application - but your phone is out of range. $A[Damn it!] You were quite certain there was service back in the village, but you really don't feel like doing another 1 hour walk down. And then up again. //Ugh.//<div id="center">$gar</div> Entering the garden, you make your way down a crooked road and eventually arrive at a large grey manor built into the hillside. It’s several stories high, a central part and two wings with several towers and balconies looming over the mournful landscape. It’s hard to make out everything in the darkness, but you estimate it has at least two dozen guest rooms, perhaps more. <img src="images/tr/characters/ionut_3.png" width="400" align="right" class="char"> $A[Wow... the place must have been a real luxury resort back in the day, perhaps then the village was a popular tourist destination? A shame, now it reeks of disuse and decay... Could be a cool place to stay, but I doubt they get many visitors. On the bright side, my job as a receptionist is probably going to be a whole lot of sitting around, waiting and doing nothing. Perhaps I could go back down to the village and find a pub, befriend the locals? Or maybe get back to that book I've always wanted to write?] A thought for later. For now, you should just move in. As you approach the main entrance, the front door creaks open and a silhouette of a man emerges from inside, carrying a metal candlestick. $A[Yeah, definitely using the old building and the props as a means of attracting more visitors...] Soon you're close enough to make out his features - he's middle aged, probably in his late fifties, with pale skin and bald head bearing a number of scars. $Io['You must ve Alex. Ve vere vaiting for you. Come in.'] He takes your luggage and disappears inside. (display:"goto")[[Follow him.]] (set: $ionut_avatar to 1) (set: $timeStarted to true) $I[New character entry added to journal] ($nChar: "The Servant")<div id="center">$T[-ENTRANCE-]</div> You stumble inside a reception room with a dusty wooden desk and several hallways splitting in different directions. On the right side there is a large staircase leading somewhere up in the darkness. The whole place is scarcely illuminated by a handful of candles, most attached to the walls. $Io['Your room vill be ready in a moment.'] The man drops your luggage on the floor and takes the staircase, which creaks under each of his heavy steps. You follow the glow of his candle as he moves up until he takes a turn and disappears somewhere on the upper floor. (display:"eye")[[Examine the desk]] (display:"eye")[[Examine the hallways]] (display:"goto")[[Patiently wait]] <div id="center">$T[-ENTRANCE-]</div> The desk is relatively large and made from heavy, thick wood. It's furniture from another generation, when chairs and desks were built to last. You don't think you could ever move it, even if you tried. There's also a little stand on it with a sign that currently reads "CLOSED". Behind it is a stack of other signs - you flip through them: "OPEN", "BACK IN 10 MINUTES", "BEWARE OF DOG". The last one looks like it hasn't been used for a while. $A[So this is going to be my new workplace...] [(display:"eye")(link: "Circle to the other side")[ (replace:?desk)[You move from the place of a visitor to the receptionist's seat. A part of you feels like you're trespassing, but you calm it down - after all this is your desk now. There are a handful of drawers filled with paperwork that is too difficult to read in this light. You find the usual objects - pens, scissors, a guest register, a little whistle. Everything seems ordinary.] ] ]<desk| (display:"eye")[[Examine the hallways]] (display:"goto")[[Patiently wait]]<div id="center">$T[-ENTRANCE-]</div> You make a few steps into the hallways and the darkness quickly envelops you. Despite the candles the visibility is terrible and you get the feeling that the receptionist's desk is left somewhere far behind. With a slight unease you hurry to return to the relative illumination of the entrance. (display:"eye")[[Examine the desk]] (display:"goto")[[Patiently wait]] <div id="center">$T[-ENTRANCE-]</div> The minutes tick as you absent-mindedly fiddle with your phone, playing sudoku. There's still no service. $Mi['Good evening,'] comes a voice from behind. Startled, you turn around. <img src="images/tr/characters/mihai2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char"> A young gentleman with a black suit and a golden cane is staring at you under his eyebrows. $Mi['I'm Mihai Petrescu, the owner of the Crooked Elm. Or rather, the owner is my father, Vasil Petrescu, who is now too old to manage the business.'] (display:"talk")[['Hello']] (display:"talk")[['I'm Alex']] (display:"talk")[['Nice to meet you']] (set: $mihai_avatar to 1)(set: $time to "20:00") (set: $hour to 20) (set: $minute to 15) $I[New character entry added to journal] ($nChar: "Mihai, the Landlord")<div id="center">$T[-ENTRANCE-]</div> <img src="images/tr/characters/mihai2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char"> The man looks at you with a blank stare. $a['I'm-'] $Mi['I know who you are. I have your file, right here.'] Mihai produces a paper from one of his pockets. $Mi['Twenty-two years old. Single. Somewhat educated.'] $a['I went to university for three years...'] $Mi['There's no shame. We have a library - you're free to use it, should you have the time. Speaking of which-'] Mihai takes out a metal key ring with four heavy keys. $Mi['Here are your personal keys. One is for the gate outside, one for the front door, the library and for your room.'] You take the keys and hold them awkwardly in your hand. (set: $ionut_avatar to 2) ($nChar: "Ionut, the Servant") $I[Character entry updated in journal]] (replace:?q2)[] ]<div id="center">$T[-ENTRANCE-]</div> $Mi['Very well, then. I'll show you to your room.'] Mihai heads to the staircase and starts climbing, waving you a hand to follow him. In the candlelight the many jeweled rings on his hand glitter mysteriously. You grab your bags and one of the candles. (display:"goto")[[Climb up]]<div id="center">$T[-FLOOR 1-]</div> The upper floor is covered by a soft red carpet that absorbs almost all noise. You can see a variety of weapons and trophies hung on the walls, as well as an ominous figure standing at the far end. You squint your eyes and then relax - it's just an old piece of armor. <img src="images/tr/characters/mihai2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char"> You try to tentatively stomp the floor, but it's almost inaudible. For a while you're lost in the silence, not hearing the familiar tapping of Mihai's cane. Silence and darkness... Your eyes fall on a golden door right in front of you. One of many, in fact, as you realise looking both ways. $A[I wonder what the room is like...] $Mi['Over here, Mister Reid'] You see the light of the candle to the right, moving upwards still to the next floor. (display:"eye")[[Maybe take a quick glance inside the room...]] (display:"goto")[[Follow]]<div id="center">$T[-FLOOR 2-]</div> <img src="images/tr/characters/mihai2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char"> The next floor is almost identical, save for the carpet being purple and the doors a dark green. You can make out a handful of portraits along the walls, but before you have time to look properly at any of them, Mihai continues upwards. (display:"goto")[[Follow->Mihai continues upwards.]]<div id="center">$T[-FLOOR 1-]</div> You grab the doorhandle and twist it to the side, when you get the eerie sensation that you're being watched. With the corner of your eye you catch a flickering in the distant end of the hallway. You turn around, but there's nothing there. Even with squinting your eyes, you can't tell what was the thing that flickered. $A[What the hell...? Do they have security cameras in this place?] You look left and right again, trying to locate the source of your anxiety, but the dark hallways offer little consolation. In the end you leave the door alone. (display:"goto")[[Follow your host->Follow]]<div id="center">$T[-ATTIC-]</div> The third floor is noticeably different, with naked walls and many doors that have been locked or even nailed shut. <img src="images/tr/characters/mihai2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char"> $Mi['The garrets and storage rooms are on this floor.'] says Mihai. $Mi['As well as the staircases that lead to the towers. But Ionut will give you a proper tour around tomorrow. You must be terribly tired. This is your room.'] He leads you to a door located not far on the left, quite similar to the others, except for the noticeable lack of padlocks or chains. Mihai produces a single key from the inside of his vest and with a subtle //click// the door opens. $A[That must be the master key that opens every door around here... makes sense. No need for *him* to carry a large batch of keys around.] $Mi['Sleep well. Tomorrow is Sunday and we aren't expecting any visitors, so you'll have the day to yourself. Use it to get familiar with the place. Go to the village if you like, but don't spend the whole day there. Your work starts on Monday morning. Ionut will explain your duties.'] You nod and smile politely. (display:"goto")(link-reveal-goto:"Go to your room","your room")[ (set:$door to 0) (set: $time to "21:30") (set: $hour to 21) (set: $minute to 30) ] <div id="center">$room</div> Small and simple, your room has just the bare necessities - a bed, a wardrobe, a desk and a chair. A single window is looking out to what you expect is the back garden. There is also a nightstand with a drawer and a lamp, candlestick and an inkwell on top. $A[Power seems to go out pretty often...] $I[ [ ]<act| ] (display:"eye")(link-repeat:"Look into the wardrobe")[(replace: ?act)[$wardrobe] ] (display:"eye")(link-repeat:"Look into the drawer")[(replace: ?act)[$drawer ] ] [ (display:"goto") (link:"Lock the door")[(replace: ?act)[$I[The door is now locked] ] (replace:?lock)[]] <br>]<lock| [(display:"goto"){(link:"Unpack your stuff")[ (set:$wardrobe to "A few t-shirts, jeans and socks; some blankets, a spare pillow") (replace: ?act)[$I[You store a handful of t-shirts, jeans and socks into the wardrobe.] ] (replace:?task)[ $I[You have completed a task! Looking through the window in the daylight, you can see a large garden spanning behind the manor - alleys lined with elm trees, stone benches and statues, even a little fountain. You get dressed, picking a pair of jeans and t-shirt. The day is ahead of you, but perhaps first you should have some breakfast? $prot[($nTask: "New task: Explore the Manor and the Village")] (display:"goto")[[To the dining room->some breakfast]] (set: 0)(set: $read_day to 0)}<div id="center"> [$T[-Transylvania-]]<fontbig| </div> (set: $startHAX to 1) Welcome to Transylvania! This is an interactive text-based adventure that focuses on horror and mystery. Your choices matter, so think carefully how you want to handle the situations that are presented to you. **Please note that as a horror experience, some scenes contain light amounts of gore. This is why the game is marked as 18+ and viewer discretion is advised.** (Disclosure : this game uses cookies to save your progress locally.) **I AM A NEW PLAYER** (display:"goto")[[Begin the game->Start2]] **I HAVE PLAYED BEFORE** $T[Chapter 1] (display:"goto")[Skip Prologue]<vet| $T[Chapter 2] (display:"goto")[Simulate progression to chapter 2]<sim| (set:$hour to 14) (set:$minute to 00) (set:$day to "Tuesday") (set: $money to 0) (set: $test to 1) (click:?new)[(goto:"Start2")] (click:?vet)[(goto:"Sleep2")](click:?sim)[(goto:"Simulate progression to chapter 2")](if: $intro is 3)[(goto:"day1_short")]<div id="center">$din</div> After some searching you find the dining hall on the ground floor, near the reception. It's a spacious room lined with tall windows creating the illusion of a glass wall looking towards the garden. The light that stems in is a dirty grey, and while a little melancholic, you don't find it unpleasant. <img src="images/tr/characters/ionut_3.png" width="400" align="right" class="char"> You look at the antique chairs and tables, wondering if they're fully functional or just for decoration. $Io['Sit! Today - I cook. Vat do you vant?'] The servant's face peers through an opening in the opposite wall, complete with a metal counter and stacks of plates. $A[That must be the kitchen...] $a['I'll have eggs and bacon.'] you shout back. $Io['Coming vright up!'] Soon you hear a pleasant sizzling and then Ionut comes out, dropping a hot plate of bacon and eggs on your table. You notice that he walks a little funny, but your mind is busy elsewhere. $A[Perhaps his leg hurts?] It doesn't matter. You start munching and tell yourself that he doesn't look like a bad guy after all. Yesterday he looked a little creepy, insidious even, but right now you're willing to believe he's just the average Joe who happens to have a strong accent and misshapen, bald head. It's hardly his fault. $Io['It is gud, ja?'] $a['Ja, ja, sehr gut!'] you reply instinctively. The trip through Europe really scrambled your head with languages. Before you can correct your mistake however, he returns to the kitchen. (display:"goto")[[Finish your eggs.]] (set: $hour to 9)(set: $minute to 30)(set: $tour to 0)(set: $library_found to 0)<div id="center">$din</div> You push your empty plate aside and pat your belly. That was a good breakfast. As if sensing that you're done, the servant emerges again and comes to sit in front of you, placing two cups of coffee on the table. $Io['Nice to meet. I Ionut.'] he grins at you. $a['Hello, Ionut, I'm Alex,'] you reply. There is an awkward pause. $Io['So, start tomorrow.'] $a['Yes. What do I have to do?'] $Io['Several things. Virst: stay at reception.'] $a['The whole day?'] $Io['From 6 to 10.'] $a['6 to 10?!' that's 16 hours!'] $Io['No, only 4 hours'], he corrects you - $Io['6 in the avternoon.'] You look at Ionut, confused. $Io['Nobody come early. Guest come - they sleep; they go.'] $A[That explains why the pay is so low...but I'll have lots of free time, so that's not too bad.] (display:"talk")[[Do many people come here?]] (display:"talk")[[What else do I have to do?]] (if: $ionut_avatar is 1)[(set: $ionut_avatar to 2) ($nChar: "Ionut, the Servant") $I[Character entry updated in journal] ]<div id="center">$din</div> $Io['Help move their luggage to room. Give key, of course. Keys behind desk.'] Ionut takes a sip from his coffee, as if thinking if he's forgetting anything. His skin, pale and thick, makes his face look like an unfinished clay sculpture. $a['So... that's it?'] You still can't believe that your work day is only 4 hours. $Io['That's it. During day you free. If need help - I ask, you come. If Mister Petrescu need something - he tell you. Rest of time - up to you. Try not get lost in the forest.'] You drink your own coffee, letting the information sink in. It seems that you'll have some time on your hands. (display:"talk")[[So, can you give me a tour?]] (display:"talk")[[Thanks Ionut, that's all for now.]](if:$intro>1)[(goto:"short_tour")]<div id="center">$rec</div> $Io['Yes. Come.'] You stand up and follow the servant. $Io['Ve are in the dining hall. If you vant breakvast - before 11. If you vant dinner - betveen 20 and 22. Else - stay hungry.'] Looking at Ionut, it's hard to tell if he's being serious or is attempting some kind of joke. In either case, he continues the tour. $Io['Ground floor - center - reception; left side - kitchen; right side - saloon, rooms for games.'] $a['Games?'] $Io['Mostly cards and pool. Go if you vant. Avter that - library. Need key.'] $a['Yes, Mr. Petrescu gave me one yesterday.'] $Io['Good.'] Ionut waves towards the stairway. (set: $library_found to 1) (display:"goto")[[Climb upstairs->up the stairs]] <div id="center">$din</div> Ionut gives you a nod and finishes his coffee. While he drinks, you notice that the thumb on this right hand is abnormally large and a slightly different shade. $A[Perhaps a birth defect?] He returns to the kitchen with his slightly waddling walk, leaving you alone with your thoughts. The day is still young and you have some options of what to do. (display:"talk")[[What else do I have to do?]] <div id="center">$kit</div> Ionut is bent over the sink, washing dishes. $Io['Need something?'] he asks without turning around. <img src="images/tr/characters/ionut_3.png" width="400" align="right" class="char"> (if: $tour is 0)[(display:"excl")[[So, can you give me a tour?]]<br> ] (display:"bk")[[No, I'm good->Reception]] (set: _ti to 8) (if: $intro is 3)[(goto:"dinner_short")]<div id="center">$rec</div> (display:"rec.mood") (if: $hour>=23)[ $R[The day is over. You walk along it for a while, but it keeps going as far as you can see, the terrain becoming rougher and even less well-kept the farther away from the mansion you go. Eventually the low, sickly grass is replaced by ever taller thorns and bushes, making your advance difficult. When you're about to give up, you notice another $in[gate] in the fence. (display:"goto")[[Go to the gate->gate]] (set: _ti to 20)<div id="center">$vil</div> You know that the village isn't much, but it's still your closest link to civilization, so you force yourself to do the hour walk downhill, trying not to think that you'll have to climb back again. You arrive at the village winded, but the fresh mountain air helps you quickly cool down. The tall mountain trees cast the village into a deep shade and despite the burning summer sun in its zenith, the place feels veiled from its heat. (if: $duh is 0)[(set: $hour to ($hour+1))] $A[Like it was in another world...] You explore the village roads, the fleeting faces of its inhabitants glancing at you through the windows as you go. You never meet anyone's gaze directly, but you can feel their eyes on the back of your head, following you around. (set: $duh to 1) You expected the village to be only a few simple households, but during your walk you discover there is an $in[antique shop], a small $in[inn] and a $in[hunting cabin]. (display:"goto")[[Have a look at the antique shop->antique shop]] (display:"goto")[[Go to the hunting cabin->hunting cabin]] (display:"goto")[Visit the inn]<inn| (click:?inn)[(if: $inn_visited is 0)[(goto:"inn")](elseif: $inn_visited is 1)[(goto:"inn2")]]<div id="center">$ant</div> Hidden in between two massive stone houses, the antique shop is a sort of extension linking its neighbours, making you think of some sort of small critter that saw an empty space and decided to dwell there. Its narrow facade - with barely enough space for a small door and a single window - and irregular architecture is the reason you miss it the first few times, but you eventually notice the faded inscription in front "ANT QUE BOUTI UE". You push the door of the boutique, bending a little to avoid hitting your head on the low doorframe. The inside of the shop is dusty and cramped with hundreds of small objects - you see furniture and decorations; jewelry, small figurines and toys; watches, mostly mechanical as far as you can tell; pens and quills; posters, stamps and postcards, a lot of ornate boxes and an immense sea of undefined and unknowable shapes. The shop is illuminated by small electric bulbs that cover everything with a dirty, yellow light, as if it was a second-hand light used and reused throughout the centuries and too tired to shine like it used to. The boutique, though cramped and narrow, extends inward, like the belly of a giant whale which has swallowed thousands of objects over its life and now lies comatose, slowly digesting. With the corner of your eye you sense something moving. (display:"goto")[[Turn around->turn towards it.]]<div id="center">$vil</div> [A large stone building near the center of the village, the inn is indistinct from the other houses save for the painting of a barrel of ale on its front door. You approach the window, but it's too dirty to peer inside. $I[[ ]<ac|] (display:"goto")(link-repeat: "Knock on the door")[(replace: ?ac)[(either:"You wait, but there's no answer. At first glance she appears no older than yourself, probably in her early twenties. Her hair is dark and curly, with a tinge of violet, her skin - flawless and pale like marble, and her green eyes - is that a hint of yellow? - peer straight through you with a wild, feline stare. <img src="images/tr/characters/felicia_desk.png" width="600" align="right" class="char" id="feliciaPC"><img src="images/tr/characters/felicia2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char" id="feliciaMobile"> $M['See something that you like?'] she purrs at you. $a['I- uh-, wha-'] $M['You look like a man in need of an accessory.'] She decides looking you up and down. $M['Perhaps a watch?'] Without waiting for your reply, she transitions instantaneously from one side of the counter to the other, standing next to you, her fingers already picking different watches from the dusty shelves, giving them a soft brush before sliding them around your wrist, giving a short $M["tss, tss, not the right one"] and putting them back on the row again. $a['I-, oh-, wait-'] $M['Not a watch then? I understand. Not really your thing. But you need something, oh yes, I can sense that you need something. Something to keep you safe, something to keep you //fresh//.'] $a['To keep me wha-'] $M['Oh, I know! I have the right thing for you!'] (display:"goto")[[Stare with confusion->right thing for you!]]<div id="center">$ant</div> The woman disappears into the belly of the beast, her movements fast and perfectly silent. Within several heartbeats she returns, carrying something in her hand. Before you can react she wraps it around your wrist, tying it with a little knot. You look down and notice that you now have a new $in[bracelet]. ($nItem: "New items: a strange bracelet") [(display:"eye")Examine the bracelet]<br| (click: ?br)[(replace:?br)[It's made out of leather laces and decorated with small, dark beads. They're perfectly smooth and cold, with a shiny, reflective surface. $A[Perhaps obsidian?] In the center of the bracelet there are 5 larger, crimson beads, with the central piece being the largest. Strangely enough, they feel a little warm and you can't quite identify the material, though you suspect some sort of polished gemstone.]](set: $bracelet to 1) (set: $bcharges to 5) (display:"talk")[[Uhm, thanks]] (display:"talk")[[Sorry, but I can't afford this]]<div id="center">$ant</div> $M['Don't mention it.'] She smiles and swishes her tail. $A[WHAT?!] <img src="images/tr/characters/felicia_desk.png" width="600" align="right" class="char" id="feliciaPC"><img src="images/tr/characters/felicia2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char" id="feliciaMobile"> You blink a couple of times and look again. (if: $maintask is 1)[($nTask: "Humble Beginnings: Begin work") ($nTask: "An unexpected gift: Learn more about the bracelet")] $I[Your journal has been updated!] (set: $maintask to 2)(set: $task_felicia to 1) (if: $hour < 18)[(display:"goto")[[Go to the hunting cabin->hunting cabin]] (display:"goto")(if: $inn_visited is 0)[[[Go to the inn->inn]]](elseif: $inn_visited is 1)[[[Go to the inn->inn2]]] (display:"goto")[[Go to the antique shop]] (display:"bk")[[Return to the manor]] ](if: $hour >= 18)[ $R[It's very late. You knock, but there's no answer. [[Back->the village]] (set: _ti to 20)<div id="center">$mount</div> You leave the village behind, your head filled with more questions than answers. You wanted to stretch your feet a little and locate any potential points of interest that could distract you during your working holiday; instead, you stumbled upon a mysterious woman in an eerie shop and a village full of secretive inhabitants. The more you think about it the fuzzier your memories become, to the point where you start questioning if it wasn't all just a dream. But then you look down on your wrist, the little bracelet dangling inconspicuously with its strange beads as if it was pretending to be a normal object. //Pretending.// A shiver runs down your spine. The uphill climb is as tiring as it was yesterday and when you climb back up to the manor an hour later you're panting and sweating. Fortunately the cool mountain air quickly refreshes you and with confident steps you [[head to the front entrance.->Reception]] (set: _ti to 60)<div id="center">$vil</div> You approach the door of the inn again, but the trap door opens before you even knock. 'I told you to go avay!' the man shouts, slamming it in your face. (set: _ti to 30) $hishills[(display:"eye")(link-reveal-goto:"History of the hills")[ (set: $books_read to it + 1) (set: $hishills to false)] ]$antcat[(display:"eye")(link-reveal-goto:"The antique cat")[ (set: $books_read to it + 1) (set: $antcat to false)] ]$legmount[(display:"eye")(link-reveal-goto:"Legends from the Mountains")[ (set: $books_read to it + 1) (set: $legmount to false) ] ] <div id="center">$lib</div> It appears to be some sort of history book, the yellow pages printed with the heavy, slightly smudged ink of the old printing press. You open the volume at page 25: $B1[**Dating back to the Slavic tribes before the middle ages, the inhabitants of what is known today as the Romanian mountains have always followed a strict code of social and geopolitical hierarchy, separating the region into autonomous constituencies known as "hills". Every hill had its own ruler, a hereditary title, who held power over the land and its people and in exchange vowed to protect his subjects. Some believe that the modern expression "king of the hill" originated from these early societal structures. Throughout the history of the region, different countries and kings have claimed the territories to be within their borders, but they have mostly respected the hills and their power.**] It's not a bad read, but you progress slowly, often checking words with the romanian dictionary you downloaded on your phone. After a while you decide that there are better things you could do with your time. (set: _ti to 30) (display:"books.nav")<div id="center">$lib</div> It's a small book with black covers made from some soft tissue. On the front there is a faded picture of a cat standing on top of a pile of books. The colors are faded now but it's clear that they were once vibrant and gay. You're not quite sure why you picked it up, other than the fact that it had "antique" in the title. The language is somewhat difficult to read as your Romanian is far from perfect. You open the first page: $B[There once was a cat, who found an old key She meowed and she purred with eyes full of glee for the key, that she knew, opened a box a box full of books and trinkets and clocks] //What is this? A children's nursery rhyme?// You abandon the poem and [[flip to a new page]] (set: _ti to 8) <div id="center">$lib</div> A red volume with thin white paper, "Legends from the Mountains" is a collection of myths and old tales accompanied with exquisite drawings in colour. You open a chapter at random: $B2[//Transylvanian folklore has become known worldwide for its legends about **vampires**. One of the common misconceptions however, associated with this mythos, is the portrayal of the vampire as a solitary creature that inhabits some distant and forsaken place such as a castle or a ruin. In truth, vampires are depicted in the old tales as social creatures that live in packs and abide by a strict hierarchy. Every pack is led by an Elder, a powerful being that has acquired knowledge and skills over centuries. He is followed by his son^^1^^ and then by a handful of lesser vampires who usually do not live in the same place but in surrounding villages or dwellings, which together form the **Elder Covenant**. ^^1^^//]$B2sub[ The Elder always has a single son to avoid infights for the heritage. While vampires are portrayed with a lifespan of centuries, they're not believed to be immortal, and thus the son eventually replaces his father and becomes the new Elder. Elders do not take other vampires for wives for the same reason - a potential claim for power - and thus resort to humans for the purpose of breeding.] (set: _ti to 30) (display:"books.nav") <div id="center">$lib</div> $B[She hid from $ups[the men] and their twisted ways $rev[and found a new home in that cursed place] a home in the shadows $ups[between two ancient stones] guarded by $ups[spirits] and a key made of bones] (set: $antcat to false) (set: _ti to 30) You blink a couple of times, unable to concentrate on the text. The bracelet is hanging comfortably around your wrist, its presence somehow comforting against the creaking of the old building and the howling of the wind in the dead branches outside. Even in the cold light of the morning the manor looks shadowy and unwelcoming, the dust hanging in the air like thick goo. <img src="images/tr/characters/Elise_v2.png" width="320" align="right" class="char"> To your surprise, one of the doors on your right opens and a woman walks out in the hallway, walking towards you without a sound. She is tall and dark - her ebony skin and short black hair reflecting the light with an almost metallic sheen. However what is most peculiar about her are her proportions - her head is small and thin, her stick-like arms flail around her equally thin torso which is covered with a tight leather jacket. And still, despite this slim and skinny upper section, under her waist her body bulges out into an entirely different shape: her ass - round and protruding - is almost a separate entity altogether, occupying - you genuinely wonder - almost as much space as the rest of her. (set: _ti to 8) As she closes the distance towards you, her round green spectacles - glare straight at you, like a pair of alien eyes. Her gaze makes your heart pound faster, filling you with indescribable, inexplicable emotions. (set: _ti to 15) $I[Task completed in journal: **Humble beginnings**] (set: $maintask to 3) (set: $task_clothes to 1) $I[New task added to journal: **A helping hand**] $I[New task added to journal: **Style maketh man**] $prot[($nTask: "Task completed: Humble beginnings") ($nTask: "New task: A helping hand") ($nTask: "New task: Style maketh man")] (display:"30m")[[Have breakfast]](if: $dead is 1)[(goto:"Have breakfast2")]<div id="center">$din</div> You take a table at the opposite side of the room, leaving Mihai at a safe distance. (if: (history:) contains "enter the room")[For an instant your blood freezes and a deep sensation of dread overtakes you.(if:$ionut_level is 1)[You see Ionut's figure towering above you, holding a shovel. A few minutes later, while you're eating in the semi-complete darkness of the dining hall, a new silhouette enters the room. You immediately identify the bizarre outline of the woman you met earlier. She takes a seat across the table from Mihai, occupying what appears to be the biggest armchair you've ever seen, with a seat large enough for two people to sit on side by side comfortably and a tall back covered in numerous fancy cushions. Her slim body and small round head look almost ridiculous in comparison, yet somehow she seems to fill the chair quite nicely with the rest of her body... Looking at her you start getting a headache and you move your gaze away, rubbing your tired eyes. The room is so dark and the candles so faint that the shadows are starting to play tricks on you.. Bits of the conversation make their way to you, but it's too low and jumbled to make any sense. $E2['My $ups[children] will....yes that's right....safe place...$rev[new host] very soon...'] $Mi2['I'll see what I can do.... will be $ups[arranged]....for $rev[your brood]..' ] (set: _ti to 60) (if: $dead is 0)[Quietly and without looking at your host, you finish eating.](elseif: $dead is 1)[$A[I wonder what this is all about...] ] (display:"goto")(link:"To the kitchen")[(goto:"To the kitchen")] (display:"bk")(link:"To the reception")[(goto:"ground floor")] (set: $seen_mihai to 1)<div id="center">$kit</div> (if: $gas is 1)[(goto:"empty_kitchen")] (else:)[(display:"Ionut main") (display:"Ionut reflect") (if: $ionut_visited is false and $dead>0)[(display: "ionut_lewd") ](else:)[<br>](if: $gen is 1)[ (display:"key")[['Mihai told me to get the key to the basement.'->getkey]] ] (display:"bk")(link-goto:"'Nothing, sorry to bother you'","ground floor") ] (set: _ti to 8)<div id="center">$gar</div> You walk along it for a while, but it keeps going as far as you can see, the terrain becoming rougher and even less well-kept the farther away from the mansion you go. There are matches left near the hatch and you use them to light a torch which illuminates well enough the space several feet around you. There are pipes and valves covering most of the east wall and going into the ceiling, as well as a handful of crates, a workbench and some tools hanging near it, more torches and cobwebs wobbling by the cold draft; and of course, there is the [[generator]]. (display:"eye")[[Take a peek around->take a peek around]] (display:"goto")[Go down the stairs]<godown| (click: ?godown)[ (if: $elise_trial >0)[ (goto:"ground floor") ] (elseif: $elise_seen is 0 and $dead is 0)[ (goto:"Go down the stairs") ] (elseif: $elise_seen is 0 and $dead is 1)[ (goto:"go down for breakfast") ] (elseif: $elise_seen is 0 and $lav_firstdeath is 0)[ (goto:"Hurry down the stairs") ](elseif: $elise_seen is 0 and $lav_firstdeath > 0)[ (goto:"Gather your courage and go down") ] (else:)[ (goto:"ground floor") ] ]<div id="center">$att</div> To hell with the rules! Nobody will ever know a thing... You start climbing, using the screen of your phone as a source of light to guide your way. Even if there isn't any reception up here, at least it's good for something. The staircase continues for quite some time, spiraling upwards for what seems like hundreds of steps. From time to time there are doors on the side, but you're really interested in getting to the top. After what seems like an eternity, you reach the last step and a small platform leading to a single wooden door. Fortunately enough, there isn't any lock here, only a brass handle that looks like it hasn't been used in a while. You draw a deep breath and [[enter the room]].<div id="center">$dark</div> The faint light of your screen illuminates a small halo around you in what seems like complete and total darkness. There aren't any silhouettes of objects around you - no furniture, no old stuff, nothing at all. You turn to all directions but as far as you can tell the room is empty. And completely dark. It's a darkness that envelops you and sticks to your clothes, a rich and dense darkness which makes it hard to breathe and almost drowns you. Walking in a straight line you reach the wall - and indeed the windows - and examine them with increasing astonishment. They have been covered with some black and impenetrable material that makes it impossible to tell that it's actually day outside. Raising your phone higher, you see something big and round hanging from the ceiling above. It shifts uneasily, as if irritated by the light you're pointing towards it, it's enormous leathery wings curling to protect it's head... '**Vat have you done!!!**' You turn around to the enormous figure of Ionut charging towards you at full speed. $A[**'Wait, I was ju-'**] He swings at you in a blur and you feel something cold and heavy on the side of your head, followed by a metallic taste in your mouth and the world [[fading away....]] $I[Task completed: **Locks, keys, and secrets**] (set: $task_elder to 3) ($nTask: "Task completed: Locks, keys and secrets") $sc1[$sys[You have learned a new secret: The Tower] (set: $secrets to (it +1)) ($nSecret: "The Tower") (set: $sc1 to false )] <div id="center">$T[-???????-]</div> The ground beneath you is cold and rough, the rocks painfully digging into your spine. Your entire body feels numb and heavy, as if an enormous weight was pushing you down. With great effort you force your eyes open and stare at the grey sky above. And the walls of earth around you. $A[**'Mhmhmhmhmhm!!!'**] You try to scream, but your mouth is gagged. Ionut, towering somewhere above you, continues his work with the shovel, slowly and methodically burying your body five feet into the barren soil. Panic sets in and you begin to struggle, trying to get out, but your(if:$dead>0)[ weak, feminine] hands and feet are bound and the increasing weight of the earth on top of you is too much. (display:"goto")[[Return to the hotel->best option]] <div id="center">$dark</div> <img src="images/tr/scenes/wolf.png" width="800" align="right">The road is dark and barely distinguishable, even under the full moon. If you hadn't already walked it a number of times you'd be long lost. The forest, black and forbidding, is eerily quiet save for the wind blowing between the pines. Then there is another sound - the distant howling of wolves, somewhere to the east. You're acutely aware just how dangerous this path can be at night. You should have never stayed this late at the village, but damn the time flew impossibly at the antique shop. Suddenly you catch something with the corner of your eye, a blurry movement between the trees on the other side of the stream. Curiosity however is topped by the voice of caution and your pace quickens, not waiting to see what is lurking about. As you turn a corner on the road, a few hundred feet farther upstream, you see a silhouette of a man blocking the way. (set: _ti to 10) (display:"goto")[[Leave the path->darkness of the trees]]<div id="center">$dark</div> You leave the clearing of the path and plunge into the forest. When you feel that you've lost your pursuer, whoever it was, you finally stop to catch your breath, leaning your back behind a big mossy boulder. Eventually you reach a section where numerous dresses and overcoats are left hanging, followed by other old garments of all varieties.", "You take the familiar path downhill following the little stream. Perhaps the mountain air is already having a positive effect or perhaps you're getting used to the road, but this time the trip is less exhausting. The forest around you is beautiful in an eerie way, the tall trees casting a deep shade that has stifled most of the low vegetation between them, creating a surprisingly clear space on the ground, filled mostly with lots of dry pinecones and the occasional bush.", "The doors of the hatch take some effort to lift but you eventually manage to open them, removing the vines that have already started to crawl on top. The inside of the basement is more akin to the opening of a dungeon, with a cold stony floor and pillars supporting the manor on top. There are matches left near the hatch and you use them to light a torch which illuminates well enough the space several feet around you. There are pipes and valves covering most of the east wall and going into the ceiling, as well as a handful of crates, a workbench and some tools hanging near it, more torches and cobwebs wobbling by the cold draft; and of course, there is the generator. On the opposite side of the room there is another door leading further down...", "With a hungry stomach, you enter the dining hall and are greeted with a strange sight. All the windows have been covered with heavy wooden shutters from the exterior, such that barely any sunlight enters the room at all. To compensate for this, candles have been lit on almost all of the tables, their faint flames doing little but pushing the darkness a couple of feet away. Sitting on a large ornate table not far from the entrance, you recognise the silhouette of a man with a golden cane. 'Ah, Mr. Reid. Coming for some breakfast?' 'Yes, I was hungry... pardon my curiosity, Mr. Petrescu' - you decide to lean on the side of caution when addressing your boss - 'but what is all this?' 'Just having breakfast with an old friend, no cause for worry. It's much more romantic this way, don't you find?' Something in his tone implies that disagreement is not really an option. 'Yes, of course, Mr. Petre-' 'Although it would be better with the grand chandelier' - he points upwards towards a heavy ball of light bulbs and crystals - 'but unfortunately the power is still down. Speaking of which, have you any intention of going down to the village today?'", "'Eggs and bakon, ja?' You give him a nod and he disappears again, followed by the sound of sizzling. A few minutes later, while you're eating in the semi-complete darkness of the dining hall, a new silhouette enters the room. You immediately identify the bizarre outline of the woman you met earlier. She takes a seat across the table from Mihai, occupying what appears to be the biggest armchair you've ever seen, with a seat large enough for two people to sit on side by side comfortably and a tall back covered in numerous fancy cushions. Her slim body and small round head look almost ridiculous in comparison, yet somehow she seems to fill the chair quite nicely with the rest of her body... Looking at her you start getting a headache and you move your gaze away, rubbing your tired eyes. The room is so dark and the candles so faint that the shadows are starting to play tricks on you.. Bits of the conversation make their way to you, but it's too low and jumbled to make any sense.", " To your surprise, one of the doors on your right opens and a woman walks out in the hallway, walking towards you without a sound. She is tall and dark - her skin and short hair black as ebony. However what is most peculiar about her are her proportions - as she advances you can see the outline of her body: her head is small and thin, and her stick-like arms flail around her equally skeletal torso which, if it has breasts at all, hides them very well under a tight leather jacket. And still despite this slim and skinny upper section, under her waist her body bulges out into an entirely different shape: her ass - round and protruding - is almost a separate entity altogether, occupying - you genuinely wonder - almost as much space as the rest of her. ", "You leave your room and head instinctively towards the staircase, when a cold breeze brushes an icy finger on your cheek. You look both ways - all the windows are closed - but after all this is a pretty old house... Suddenly, you're feeling a little curious to explore the top floor. Both Mihai and Ionut were very brief about it, and you wonder if there aren't some hidden delights to find - perhaps an opening to the roof? Surely the view to the mountain will be breathtaking. And then there are the towers... you could always take a peek around. ", "You wake up full of energy and ready to take on the world! Despite the limited commodities, you had a good night's sleep and are looking forward to your first day of work. ...which starts at 6pm. In your enthusiasm you'd almost forgotten. Still, you'll probably find something useful to do during the day! ", " "))<div id="center">$room</div> You slowly wake up, your eyes opening to the familiar view of your room's ceiling. The dark mist in your mind slowly disperses and is replaced with mounting confusion. (set: $A to ((color:#FFCCE5)+(text-style: "italic"))) (set: $a to (color:#FFCCE5)) $A[What was that....? A dream..? Hallucination? Drugs? How the hell am I alive? It was all so real...] You rise in your bed and toss the covers aside. There is an immediate and profound sensation that something is off. Then apprehension strikes - your body is different. Smaller waist; leaner, hairless legs; you raise up your hands - they're similar, but definitely different - smaller, more delicate; your gaze falls down on a pair of mounds bulging your pyjamas. You shoot out of bed and into the small bathroom attached to your chamber, where a strange new face is looking at you in the mirror. Well, some of it is not new - your eyes are the same, dark brown, unchanged; your hair is almost the same, dark straight, though perhaps longer. You concentrate on your features - they have shifted around in slight but important ways, crafting the face of a young, beautiful woman staring with an open jaw and wide, terrified eyes. Stumped in shock, you fall a few steps back. (display:"goto")[[Sit on the bed]] (set: $pers_keys to true){(live: 0.1s)[ (set: $print to ((history:)'s (((history:)'s length) - $test ))) (display: $print) (if: $test<((history:)'s length))[(set: $test to it + 1)] (if: $test is (((history:)'s length)-1))[(goto: "reborn1")] [ ]<wind| ]} <div style="text-align:center;">$T[CHAPTER 1: THE WOLF, THE BAT AND THE SPIDER] </div> You've finished the introduction of Transylvania! From now on you will have more freedom to explore the world and make a variety of choices that lead to branching paths. I recommend saving the game here in case you want to go back and do things differently. [If you wish to continue with the story blind and without spoiling anything, [[wake up<-click here.]] If you wish to know the basic mechanics of the game, [click here]<info|. ]<chap1| (click: ?info)[ $I[-the goal of each chapter is to finish the day successfully; -there are different success states that can be obtained; -most actions cost you time and as such you may not be able to do everything you wish; -some options are only available at specific times of day, such as **breakfast** and **dinner**; -likewise the options in a given location (such as the inn or library) will change throughout the game, based on your past actions and other circumstances; -your death is not the end of the game;] (display:"goto")[[Continue->wake up]] (replace:?chap1)[ ] ] (set: $bracelet to 1) (set: $ionut_avatar to 2)(set: $mihai_avatar to 2) (set: $felicia_avatar to 1) (set: $task_felicia to 1) <div id="center">$room</div> Thinking is hard and as you clutch your head with both hands your thoughts buzz inside like a swarm of angry wasps, too fast and dangerous to catch. Minutes pass until you manage to calm down your beating heart. Your gaze absent-mindedly falls on the bracelet on your hand and the (colour:"#FFCCCC")[four crimson beads] that decorate it. $A[Alright, Alex.. what's going on? Did I take any drugs? Did someone slip me something?] You let the confusion wash over you for a few minutes, then your rational mind kicks in. $A[This is real.] You pinch your thigh and the pain reaches your brain, sobering it up. $A[I'm Alex, I was a student, I grew up with my parents in England...] A wave of new and confusing memories swirls around your head, but you chase them away. $A[...and then I travelled to Romania for a summer job. Ignoring the circumstances of the event, it is quite the extraordinary experience. $A[What is it like, being a girl?] you wonder. (set: _ti to 15) <div id="center">$T[-ROOM 28-]</div> $A[What the hell is wrong with me?! This isn't the time for this! Not to mention it's just-] Words fail you. You're not sure how exactly to describe that you're turned on by the place of your own death, but it's definitely not right. (display:"excl")[[Accept the invitation]] (display:"goto")[[Politely refuse and eat alone]] (set: _ti to 8)<div id="center">$din</div> You smirk and take the bait, sitting on the designated chair. There's nobody else around anyways, so you might as well talk to the eccentric owner. $Mi[So, Mr Reid, how do you find my hotel? Is it everything that you had hoped for?] Mihai's deep voice bears only the slightest of foreign accents, resembling more the intonation of a 19th century earl. Even now his golden headed cane is with him, leaning casually on the side of his chair. <img src="images/tr/characters/mihai2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char"> You ponder your reply: <div class="choices">(display:"talk")(link-reveal-goto:"'It's easy to see that this is a respectable establishment'","respect")[ (set: $mihaiRel to it +1) (set: $din_mihai to "respect") (set: $First_choice to "respect") ($nChoice: "First impressions: Open Mind") ] (display:"talk")(link-reveal-goto:"'It's yet too early to hold an opinion, Mr. Petrescu'","undecided")[ (set: $mihaiRel to it +1) (set: $din_mihai to "undecided") (set: $First_choice to "undecided") ($nChoice: "First impressions: Undecided")] (display:"talk")(link-reveal-goto:"'It looks good, but it's all just a façade for tourists'","scam")[ (set: $mihaiRel to it +1) (set: $din_mihai to "scam") (set: $First_choice to "scam") ($nChoice: "First impressions: Scepticism") ]</div> (set: $LinkPermaChoices to true) (set: _ti to 8)<div id="center">$din</div> You shake your head politely, raising your hands in an improvised gesture of apology. The owner nods dryly and doesn't insist. $A[What an eccentric guy..] Drinking wine alone in an empty hall may seem classy, but you suspect its just part of the façade that Mihai puts up to make his hotel more attractive to tourists. No doubt he expects you tell tales of the haunted manor and mysterious owner when you get back home, hopefully fooling some of your friends and relatives into checking out the place. Now that you think about it quite a few of the guys you know are gullible enough to at least hope there would be ghosts around the place, and no doubt the owner has arranged the occasional strange noise at night to keep the visitors coming... All in all the place is quite inspiring for the right kind of person, if you forget for a moment that it's all just a front. With grim cynicism you dig into your dinner which Ionut has brought discretely on your table. After some searching you stumble upon an add in the paper that offers the job of a receptionist at a hotel in a small mountain Village in Romania. You pack your bags and head on a long trip, eventually crossing over Europe and arriving at your destination. Getting off the bus, you look around. The village itself is very small - barely a few dozen stone houses at best. The mountain air is clean and fresh, filling your nostrils with the scent of old pines and green moss. Save for a few electric lamps barely illuminating the street, it doesn’t look very modern. Judging by the architectural style, it hasn't moved in the last few centuries. Unable to locate the hotel, you talk to a strange man who sends you upwards a mountain trail, going along the river. The path is steep and it's getting dark, but after an hour of walking, you eventually arrive. The hotel is an ancient manor several stories high, a central part and two wings with several towers and balconies looming over the mournful garden. It’s hard to make out everything in the darkness, but you estimate it has at least two dozen guest rooms, perhaps more. $A[Wow... the place must have been a real luxury resort back in the day, perhaps then the village was a popular tourist destination? Perhaps I could go back down to the village and find a pub, befriend the locals? Or maybe get back to that book I've always wanted to write?] There is a fence around it, with a gate that is locked. You shout out but nobody answers. What games is she playing?] You are left with more questions than answers, as usual. The owner smiles mysteriously and leaves you to wait, disappearing somewhere in the depths of her shop. There is an eerie sensation of time stretching and condensing, like a bubble gum being chewed by a lazy panther. You have no idea where that mental image came from, but for some reason it sticks in your head. The minutes stretch, thick like honey, and the hours flow, quick like a mountain stream. [**Total Immersion**]<sel1| *(default)* You will experience the full introduction and the backstory leading up to your peculiar predicament. You will meet every character in the introduction. 2. [**Shortened intro**]<sel2| You will experience a short introduction, followed by the complete backstory leading up to your peculiar predicament. You will skip the introduction of minor events and characters and you will meet them during gameplay. 3. [**Get me into the action**]<sel3| You will experience a short introduction and a condensed version of the backstory. You will meet only the most central characters in the intro sequence (the rest you will meet directly during gameplay). </div> (click:?sel1)[(set: $intro to 1) (goto:"start3") ] (click:?sel2)[(set: $intro to 2) (goto:"start3") ] (click:?sel3)[(set: $intro to 3) (goto:"start3") ] <div id="center"> <img src="images/tr/interface/Logo.png" style="max-width=100%;"> </div> <div class="check" id="menuBOX">**STEP 2/2 - Settings** $I[Can be modified at any moment in the "Settings" menu.] (checkbox: 2bind $Tanim, " ") Text animations on death *Disabled: Text animations will only be displayed the first time you encounter them and will be skipped from then on.* (checkbox-fullscreen: " ") Fullscreen mode $R[**Fullscreen is recommended for best experience.**] (checkbox: 2bind $hintsON1, " ") Enable hints *If hints are enabled, the raven will appear occasionally on the sidebar. (set: _ti to 15) <div id="center">$lib</div> Sitting at the floor of the library you slowly compose yourself and get dressed again. Lavius has already gone, though you seem to have momentarily lost track of time. A few things bubble to your conscious attention. First, the $R[hunger] that has been increasing all day has finally subsided. What is worrying however is that even if the urges have gone down, your mind still feels very hazy. In fact, it even feels $A[hazier] than before. You feel as if you're a little drunk and concentration takes an effort. You know you should probably be more alarmed by this, but in your current state all you can do is quietly note the phenomenon. Another thing that you notice is that your bracelet hasn't changed, despite the recent "feeding". This is also something that should perhaps worry you. Back on your feet again, you finally manage to regain some of your focus, though it's clear that something isn't quite right. The library is quiet. Suddenly there is a tingling sensation at the back of your head. You turn towards the distant end of the room - the rows of shelves seem almost never ending. $A[Did someone- did someone call my name?] You hesitate. (set: _ti to 15) (display:"goto")(link-reveal-goto:"Explore the deep end","Explore the deep end")[(set: $lust to it - 30) (set: $sanity to it - 15)] <div id="center">$lib</div> Walking down the dusty aisles you begin to experience a strange sensation, one that you have felt before. There is something wrong with the space around you. The lines of the aisles somehow bend in weird ways, straight paths loop back into themselves. The further you go, the stronger the feeling becomes. The air is thick and still like glass. The bits of dust hang frozen in the distance, illuminated by rays of still light. You follow the gut feeling, turning left and right. You reach a point where you make 4 consecutive right turns, which should have looped you around a shelf... but instead you come across a [[familiar desk]]. Few people get to recall their demise. The images pop in your head... Your limp body being dragged down the dark hallway... razor sharp legs spinning silky dreams... the tightness, the constriction, and the horror that followed... You feel a droplet of cold sweat run down your spine. The experience is still fresh in your mind. It was somehow more traumatic than usual, the nightmarish appearance of the spider etched deep into your mind. You thankfully lost consciousness early enough not to feel whatever the creature did to your body, but the thought of it is enough to make your heart race. You take a deep breath and... You feel that you have overcome a part of your internal turmoil and your thinking has become a little clearer. (unless: (history:)'s last is "YOU" or "Journal")[(set: $occultism to it + 1)] (display:"occult.changed") (set: _ti to 8) (set: $sanity to it +5) (display:"goto")[[Continue->forest sit2]]<div id="center">$mount</div> You refuse to let the unknown get the better of you. No matter how strange and inexplicable these phenomena might seem, you will find a way to understand them. The world is a dark, twisted place, and it's a man's job to carry the light of wisdom and knowledge, turning the shadows of the night into things of flesh and blood. You feel that your thoughts are getting a little clearer. (unless: (history:)'s last is "YOU" or "Journal")[(set: $occultism to it - 1) ](display:"occult.changed") (set: _ti to 8)(set: $sanity to it +5) (display:"goto")[[Continue->forest sit2]]<div id="center">$mount</div> The quiet time alone in the forest is doing you some good and you feel your spirit newly refreshed. (display:"bk")[[Return to the village->village3]] (if: $occultism_trait is "occult")[$clarity[**Occultism:** ] ](elseif: $occultism_trait is "sceptic")[$clarity[**Scepticism:** ]](elseif: $occultism>0)[$clarity[**Occultism $occultism:**] ](elseif: $occultism<0)[$clarity[**Skepticism (abs: $occultism):**] ]<div id="center">$fl1</div> You already have enough proof that logic is not always the best answer. (display:"goto")[[Follow it]] (display:"goto")[[Stay where you are]]<div id="center">$fl1</div> You walk behind the figure which slowly hovers down the hallway, passing several rooms. You can see intricate scenes hammered into the surface, with warriors and creatures engaged in eternal fight. The apparition raises a hand, pointing to a part of the ornamentation. Then it hovers forwards, disappearing through the wall. $A[It seems that it's trying to tell me something...] You examine the $in[metal figures] carefully. There is a small desk with a chair, surrounded by multiple chests on the ground. The walls are lined will shelves that are stacked with old parchments. Continuing your investigation, you manage to distinguish a few things: Right in front of the desk, there is a $in[pile of parchments that have some sort of sketches] on them, which are either maps, blueprints or something of the sort. In a shelf to the left you can see a $in[giant tome with ornate covers]. This could make even a hardened wench blush like a maiden. You take the next letter. You have to know more. The images will stay with you for a while. (set: $lust to it + 5) Time is progressing and you don't want to risk someone finding you out. You better leave. (set: _ti to 10) (display:"goto")[[Hold steady]] (display:"goto")[[Have an "accident"]] <div id="center">$cem</div> $a['I'll be right behind you, Ionut, go ahead. As you walk the path you have the strange feeling that something is mirroring your movements, something underground sliding along with you. You feel its presence at the back of your mind, innately understood through senses that you can't describe nor comprehend. Finally, the crypt is upon you. It's entrance open like a stone maw, there is no door nor lock to stop you. Just a gaping mouth and stairs down into the darkness. $G[Come....] As the hairs on your skin stand on edge and your blood turns to chills, you know with absolute certainty that nothing good will come of this. (set: _ti to 15) (display:"goto")(if: $mb_fascination>0)[(display:"morbid.lab")(link-reveal-goto:"Enter the crypt")[ (set: $mb_fascination to it + 1) ]](else:)[(display:"unav")] (display:"goto")[[Run away->run crypt]]<div id="center">$cem</div> You ignore the strange feeling for now and compose yourself. $A[I can always come and explore the crypt later...] The rain falls on your skin and slides down your $breasts. (set: _ti to 10)<div id="center">$dark</div> With a morbid delight, you give in to the dark impulse and slowly yet deliberately begin your descent. The stone staircase is winding down in big, slow turns. You can't quite decide if it's a straight spiral downwards, or it's leading you off somewhere else. Surprisingly enough, there are torches on the walls here and there, though they do little more than punctuate the growing darkness. The steps are littered with pebbles and soil, as well as the occasional piece of bone. $A[Did someone drag this down from the cemetery...?] With every step, you can feel a strange tension rising. The air feels thick and heavy, every breath filling you with the taste of damp soil... and something else. You begin to feel $A[dizzy] and slightly disoriented. $G[Come... come down...] (set: _ti to 15) (display:"goto")[[Go down->Enter the crypt2]] (display:"morbid.changed")<div id="center">$cem</div> In a rare moment of lucidity, you decide to stop this madness. You turn your back to the crypt. $A[No, Alex! You are better than this! There's nothing good for you there.] And yet, you can't bring yourself to step away. The call is there, pulling you down into the darkness. $G[You want this...] You try to resist again. You can leave. Just take one step.. Suddenly you feel something cold and slimy touch your foot. You stand frozen, holding your breath. Your heart is pounding like crazy. The slimy thing coils up your leg like a snake, methodically exploring the new territory. Soon it reaches your loins and you feel the tip burrow between your legs, following your dripping juices. For a moment, the creature stops. You take a deep breath, filling your lungs with the cool mountain air. Then the worm contracts with colossal strength, pulling you [[down into the soft soil drunk<-down into the darkness]]. (set: _ti to 30)<div id="center">$undercrypt</div> (set: $alex_expr to 1) (set: $worms to (a:))(set: $belly to 0) (test-true: $depr is 1)[You are somewhere deep underground. In the near-total darkness, there is an overbearing sense of space. The air is stale, heavy with the smell of old moss and something more. Your shallow breaths are lost with only the faintest echo. $a['I-is anyone there....?'] Your fingers dig into the dirt and suddenly you feel the ground tremble and shift. The bracelet is hanging comfortably around your wrist, its presence somehow comforting against the creaking of the old building and the howling of the wind in the dead branches outside. (set: $hour to 9) (set: $minute to 0) (set: $day to "Monday") (set: $din_vis to false) (display:"goto")(link-fullscreen: "Wake up", "(goto:'chapter1.2')") <div style="text-align:center;">$T[CHAPTER 1: THE WOLF, THE BAT AND THE SPIDER] </div> You've finished the introduction of Transylvania! From now on you will have more freedom to explore the world and make a variety of choices that lead to branching paths. I recommend saving the game here in case you want to go back and do things differently. (set: _ti to 15) (display:"goto")[[Clean yourself]]<div id="center">$mount</div> As you slowly come back to your senses you realize that you are all covered in sticky white spots and dirt from the ground. You were wise to remove your clothes after all - cleaning yourself is easier than washing your $suit. You are still close to the creek that flows by the side of the road, so you decide to take a quick dip in the cool waters. It's not deep enough to swim, but you can submerge your arms and legs and splash water over your breasts, cleansing most of the fluids. After a quick air-drying you put your $suit back on, feeling lucky that it's still a summer night. With the clock ticking, you make haste back to the hotel. But on the top side you can see an area of exposed, slug-like, glistening skin, from which a handful of fleshy antennas with bulbous ends are dangling. Frozen in shock and fear, you can't even open your mouth to scream. $S['Bad girl!'] Sabrina slaps you across the face, snapping you out of the stupor. You blink fast and the creature is gone, retracting down your back. $S['I told you not to look!'] Now standing in front of you, Sabrina has a cross look on her face. $a['I'm sorry, but- this thing! It's hideous, get it off me!!'] $S['Calm down, it won't hurt you. In fact, they are quire gentle.'] $a['They?!'] $S['Indeed. But let's not get ahead of ourselves. One is enough for you for now'] The creature moves across your back, darting left and right as if to explore the new territory. Eventually it crawls down to your butt, it's head pushing between your legs.
