But beware of annoying him too much. -improved image compression for backgrounds by around 60% (loading should be much faster); **Chapter 1** -added new art when being killed by Ionut; **Sabrina and lab** -added background art for Sabrina's room; -added background art for underground lair; **Chapter 2** -the win condition for surviving the attack has been changed with an additional requirement; **Lavius in the garden** -polished dialogue and added new options if you reply this branch more than once; ==>added new scene with Lavius in the garden; -added 3 new pieces of art, depending on what Alexandra is wearing; -added dynamic descriptions based on stats; -added Trait-unlockable options; **Wolf in the garden** -polished existing scene with new outfit variations; -added the outfit-appropriate art to each variation; -added an alternative encounter if you do this branch more than once; **The Henchmen** -added new story branch: meeting the men in the forest; -added new challenge to branch; -added new erotic scenes to the challenge; -added new art to the challenge; **Patreon** -added new Lavius scene to Gallery; -added new Henchmen scene to Gallery; -made Stat Edit buttons hitbox much larger and easier to click; <div id="center">0.3.04</div> <hr> **General** -Replaced the color of $U[unimplemented options] from red to grey-blue to avoid confusion with permanent choices. -added new background art: the dining room (day); -added new background art: the dining room (dark); **Chapter 2** -improved navigation nodes and event triggers around the game room and the library; -The Grand Conspiracy questline can now be advanced one more step -added a quest recap after moving the box to the basement; -updated waking up recap after a death; **The Mermaid** -has a new interaction node for all actions and can be found in the basement at all times of day; -meeting her for the first time no longer leads to a dead end; -new challenge added; -it is now possible to uncover Lavius' motives in the "Grand Conspiracy" questline. -new erotic scene added; -new art for the erotic scene added; **The Elder** -updated interactions; -can now be convinced to help you if you have the right pieces of information; **Pit of Death** -added new location: certain actions will lead you here; -added new erotic event: the slime; -added new art: the slime; -added new erotic event: the lurker; -added new art: the lurker; **Elise** -the Elise x Felicia branch no longer terminates in a dead end; -it is now possible to uncover Elise's motives in the "Grand Consipracy" questline. **Patreon** -reworked the entire Patreon menu interface (Desktop only); -brand new Gallery tab! -brand new Travel tab! -brand new Choices tab! -improvements to Stats, Body and Clothes tabs; **Other** -updated some icons -typo fixes; -updated a few more interaction nodes in Ch1 to prevent potential stats being re-applied when exiting a menu; <div id="center">0.3.03</div> <hr> **General** -added background art for Elise's room (tidied and untidied); -added background art for the first floor of The Crooked Elm; **Lavius** -added new scene and variations when going with Lavius to his lair for a second time; -added new art for this scene; -added a new rare encounter after you've met the old woman for the second time; -added new art for the second encounter; **The Inn** -reworked the way the main hub works, adding more granular changes to the descriptions of what everyone else is doing following your interactions. The inn should now feel more responsive and alive; -added a new character - the old woman (only appears later in the story) -added a new branch - milking at the farm; -added illustration for this branch; -added a new branch when revisiting the old woman after the farm encounter; **Chapter 1** Spider Amulet -Elise's gift can now be transformed into a Spider amulet; -Amulet reduces significantly the time requirements for all actions; -Amulet can be worn or taken off at any time; -if you have romanced Ionut, he will now be sad when he kills you. **Patreon** -added the option to instantly obtain the speed amulet; -added new scenes to the gallery; **Engine** -moved to Harlowe 3.2.2, which patches several core engine errors that were introduced in the previous patch (If you've seen undefined variable errors when loading, that was caused by custom macro data type being corrupted in specific instances) -introduced a modification that prevents errors and debug functions from popping up during play if a non-critical error occurs; **Fixes** -fixed a few instances of traits being increased after closing a menu; -Ionut's scene when washing the dishes correctly takes account of what Alex is wearing; -fixed an incomplete branch form the Elder showing placeholder text when trying to convince him (branch has been removed for now until it's complete); -fixed day showing up as Wednesday for a bit when jumpstarting chapter 2; -fixed being killed by Lavius the second time not properly registering when talking with Felicia the next day; -fixed a case where Felicia would offer you pheromones even after you already have them; <div id="center">0.3.02</div> <hr> **General** -added new background art for the Antique Boutique; -created new sprite for Felicia on large screen devices; **Chapter1** -added new art set for Sabrina's grotesque training; -added new art set for Elise giving her special piercings; -extended the Elise piercing event with new description; -added new art set for the Fishing for Worms event; **Chapter 2** -the library and game room have new navigation nodes and can be visited more freely regardless of time of day; -improved overall navigation and flow of main events; **Ruxandra** -Ruxandra's story is now fully looped (the first fully complete loop module of Chapter 2); -new story branches: you can now complete the Ruxandra event without dying; -new variations; -new permanent choice; -new item: successfully completing Rux' event now gives an item that can be equipped and unequipped at any time in inventory; **Mobile** -redesigned the top bar; -changed the text links into icons; -added saving and loading; -implemented the menu upgrade that allows free navigation between menus without having to go back to the story first; -improved interface of the main body; **Patreon** -added a new benefit: unlimited and customizeable save slots; **Fixes** -passages with a background should now be properly scrollable even if the text is very short; -Ruxandra's call is no longer infinitely repeatable if you've already dug up her grave; After half an hour and a light headache, you feel like you're starting to grasp a few basic concepts. $A[If I'm understanding this correctly, an invocation can be reversed by changing the enunciation of the genitif...] You sigh and close the book. That's enough for a day, and even if you wanted, you'd probably not be able to cram more in your head right now. (set: _ti to 10) <div class="choices">(display:"goto")(link-reveal-goto: "Spare her", "Spare Ruxandra")[(set: $RuxChoice to "mercy")($nChoice: "Ruxandra: Mercy")] (display:"goto")(link-reveal-goto: "Finish the spell", "Banish Ruxandra")[(set: $RuxChoice to "justice")($nChoice: "Ruxandra: Justice")]</div> (set: $LinkPermaChoices to true)<div id="center">$gar</div> You get back up on your feet and pat down the dirt from your $suit. The garden feels eerie. The old tree stands splintered in half, with no sign of the runes or any other supernatural activity. Its dead branches no longer twist without breeze, instead laying completely motionless. $A[A sad end...] As you examine the aftermath of the lightning, you notice something poking from the charred wound. $A[The necklace!] The peculiar trinket is lying in the center of the tree, right where the lightning split it in half. Oddly enough, it doesn't seem to have been damaged in the process. You pick up the necklace and look it over. Just like before, it seems to have a reassuring aura. $A[It must have been some amulet of protection... perhaps why the spirit needed it so badly.] In any case, it's no use to her now. Perhaps it will serve you better. (set: _ti to 3) (display:"goto")[[Take the necklace ->necklace end]]<div id="center">$gar</div> (set: $pers_keys to true) You grab the necklace from the charred tree and put it on. It feels like a hard-earned war trophy and you're more than a little proud of how you handled the situation. $A[No spirit is going to mess with me...!] As you stroll back to the Crooked Elm, you take one last glance at the old tree. Its crooked silhouette is barely distinguishable among the other dead things in the garden. $A[I wonder if someone will even notice...] In any case, you have more urgent matters to worry about now. With the necklace reassuringly around your neck, you decide to press on with the matters at hand. (set: $necklace to 10) (display:"goto")(link-goto:"Return to the manor","Hotel2")<div id="center">$T[-ROOM 28-]</div> <img src="images/tr/scenes/spider_piercings0.png" width="500" align="right"> You undress and get down in front of her, bowing your head down. A black hand gives you a pat and then you feel a rope pressing against your body. With quick and precise movements, Elise moves around you, tieing you up with hands behind your back, the white threads contouring your $breasts for her. $E['Such a pretty thing you are, tsk!'] You blush but remain silent, sinking further into the weird state of letting the creature do whatever it wants with you. You are once again impressed by his overwhelming presence, a true apex predator. For all the monsters you've seen here, he is the one that reeks of the rawest power, an aura of deadly superiority that makes you feel like weak prey, even if he's on your side now. Despite his prowess and the ease with which he dealt with the previous opponents, the ancient vampire does not move with arrogance. You can sense his full alertness, the way his eyes pierce every inch of the hallway and his nostrils enlarge with every deep breath he takes. He continues moving forward, then abruptly stops at one of the intersections. There is a tunnel to the side, though you can see only darkness. In an instant, the Elder spreads his wings and dashes towards the ceiling, his hand extending to a corner veiled in shadows. Eventually the trees part, revealing a small clearing where a camp fire is blazing, surrounded by a few shadowy figures. The men are relaxed in a conversation, tossing a handful of dice on a board and smoking cigars. You can see a few bags thrown around, as well as their weapons leaning against a tree. You continue approaching the camp and a few branches crack under your feet, suddenly alerting the men to your presence. They raise to their feet, reaching for their weapons. $rando['Stay where you are!'] The leader steps forward, eyeing you up and down. The rest of the men exchange glances. (set: _ti to 10) (display:"goto")[[Misconfigure the device]] $I[You have succeeded in a sanity challenge! Your mind feels a little $clarity[**clearer**].]<div id="center">$mount</div> The backpack he's wearing is hosting what looks like a large battery, surrounded by metal cyllinders, capacitors and all sorts of wires. You can hear a low electrical hum coming from it. $L[Lavius has gone a long way in his research it seems...] The device looks like something straight of the 19th century, perhaps from Tesla's personal sketchbook. However there is more to it. For all the shiny copper and glass, you also spot other, more sinister details. Runes etched in plaques, crystals connected in strange ways. You can't quite tell where the classical technology ends and the occult begins. Despite the strange additions to the device, you manage to quickly locate the control board. It has all sorts of knobs and gauges. Luckily for you, you've once studied these things. $a['I will increase the voltage to maximum,'] you explain to the men, pointing to a knob and turning it all the way up. $a['This will drain the power very quickly, but should be strong enough to deal with the old Petrescu. Use it sparingly and wait for the right moment.'] The men look over your shoulder and nod approvingly, though you can tell that they don't really understand it. $A[Perfect... just what I was counting on!] As you make a grand point of explaining how the voltage should be kept at a max, you discretely turn the amperage way down. $A[This will barely give a zap now... fools!] As you finish setting up the device and step back, nobody seems to have noticed your trickery. $a['Alright, fellas - you're all set! I think we should get moving now, before anyone notices my absence.'] The leader turns around, flexing his arm with the device. He gives you a slightly confused look, but doesn't find any objection. $rando['You heard her men! Time for action.'] The group quickly packs the camp and prepares for departure. We can do this the easy way or the hard way!'] The men cheer, lifting their weapons and ready to fight. $Io['Get avay!'] Ionut swings the shovel at the leader, but he dodges swiftly to the side, hitting the servant on his head with a bat. Ionut sways, but doesn't fall. $R['That washn't nice!'] comes a voice from above. Just on time, a giant shadow drops from the sky, squashing a figure to the ground. The rest of the group halts. $rando['Now, get him when he falls unconscious!'] The leader swings with his arm, burying the metal device straight in the Elder's chest. There is a tiny spark that fizzles into the night. $R['Ish that all?'] You can feel the horror set in the group. The men turn towards you with angry stares, but it's too late. An arm flies off, spraying you with a splatter of blood. The metal contraption hangs on to it, cables torn. The leader's scream pierces the night, then stops abruptly, stifled by another spray of blood. The rest of the men forget about you and run for the forest. (set: _ti to 10) (display:"goto")[[Check on Ionut]]<div id="center">$mount</div> $a['Relax, fellas. It is Lavius that sent me here.'] You wave a hand non-chalantly to lower their weapons, but are met with dubious looks. $rando['Lavius? Why would he send you?'] You look the leader dead in the eye. He is a rough man and you can tell that he's used to smelling lies. Your heartbeat accelerates. Is he going to call your bluff? You had a plan in mind just moments ago, but now suddenly you find it hard to concentrate. $in[Your mind is sluggish and hazy. Your words get tangled.] $a['I-I am an uhm, **associate** of Lavius, I suppose'] The man raises an eyebrow. $rando['**Associate?** he never mentioned you, doll.'] The men group closer around you and you begin to panick. $a[I-, uhm-, met him at the inn...'] $rando['At the inn? "location", "none")) )} (set: $userPass to "")<div id="title">$T[-Notes-]</div> <hr> (input-box: 2bind $notes,"XXX=", 10) <hr> <div id="center">$dark</div> As you fall to your knees, you realize that you now have horns sprawling from the top of your head. Somehow, the change does not surprise you. You are now accustomed to changing, to $a[being molded] by the desires of a stronger will, into what they decide to make of you, into what you were $a[always meant to be]. (if: (history:)'s last is "bride mihai")[You lean forward and open your lips, accepting your new husband, $Mi[Mihai]. As your veil flaps in the wind, his stern but gentle hand guides you so that you may better fulfil your new wifely duties. Your body feels somehow... ready and you know that you are now his for all eternity - to serve and obey, to cater to all of his needs. In your heart, you know that you will make a fine wife and that he will take good care of you. <img src="images/tr/scenes/gothic_bj.png" width="650" align="right"> As his seed spills into your mouth, he lifts your chin up, gently wiping away a trickle on the side of your lip. Smiling, he lifts you up into his arms, carrying you away into [[lust and darkness->into the darkness]].](elseif: (history:)'s last is "bride lavius")[You lean forward and open your lips, accepting your new husband, $L[Lavius]. As your veil flaps in the wind, his hand reaches and eagerly pushes you forward, sliding his erect member all the way down your throat. Your body aches to be used and you know that this is exactly what awaits you - you are now his forever to play with, to serve and etnertain. In your heart, you know that you will enjoy every bit of it, regardless of what he deicdes to do with you. You are ready and eager. <img src="images/tr/scenes/gothic_bj.png" width="650" align="right"> As his seed spills into your mouth, he lifts your chin up, wiping away a trickle with the edge of your robe. Then he pulls your leash down, leading you like a dog down a long flight of stairs towards a dungeon filled with [[lust and darkness->into the darkness]].](else:)[You lean forward and open your lips, accepting your new husband, $R[Vasil]. As your veil flaps in the wind, his black hand grips you by the throat and pulls you in, showing you how to better fulfil your new wifely duties. <img src="images/tr/scenes/gothic_bj.png" width="650" align="right"> Your quiver with anticipation under his rough touch. The Elder Vampire radiates a raw, rough power that is above anything you've ever felt. $A[Aaah....] He lays a hand on your tummy, a meaningful gesture that quietly informs you of the fate that await you. In your heart, you know that you will spawn many of his descendants, over and over again until you can barely remember your name. As his seed spills into your mouth, he pulls you closer by the leash, then takes you in his giant arms, flying upwards [[into the darkness]]..] Dear supporters, As we announced on the <a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/important-and-v-59004499" target="_blank">Patreon post here </a>, in November 2021 we were contacted by Patreon staff and given an ultimatum to remove part of the content or face the termination of the project. Given the circumstances, we complied, but we would like to take the time to provide you with more details: **What was removed?** We had to remove the scenes with the werewolf, 2 of Sabrina's trainings, 1 of the pit of death options, all of Gwtllgi's content, as well as 1 of Elise's scenes. **Is the content ever coming back?** The content will not be coming back while we are on Patreon, however this does not mean that it's never coming back. We are actively exploring other solutions. **What are your plans for the future?** Our main priority is to finish the project as quickly as possible. In <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSffZ7f6yVw-BLj_LeffCraYAC8HY-K2Bhlmx-I2k5wGm1Vhdw/viewform" target="_blank">our survey</a> it was clear that the overwhelming sentiment of our fans is to move forward and use the support to push Chapter 2 and 3 to completion, delivering the end product for everyone to enjoy. Please feel free to fill out the survey and leave your thoughts. <div id="center">$dark</div> You died here once before, but you won't die here today. The darkness condenses around you and powerful wings propel you upwards, leaping through the air and out of the predator's grasp. You manage to sustain the flight for only a handful of seconds, but it's enough. You land in another pile of trash and bones, which cushions your fall. As you lift your head up, the walls of the pit are much closer, and so is the door. $A[I'm almost there!!] You scramble to get up, sending a skull bouncing down the pile and splashing into something. There is a sound of movement closing in on your new location, but you have enough of a head start. You sprint through the decaying debris, abandoning stealth for speed. Now there's movement from other sides as well, coming towards you. You try to ignore it. Now that $in[you can see in the dark], it's easier to navigate the pit without constantly slipping and tripping. You focus your efforts on a final sprint, climbing up the ridges of the pit, up and up towards $in[the door]. Finally, your fingers wrap around the metal rings of the door. It's made of heavy wood and reinforced with steel edges, but it doesn't seem to be locked. You push and one wing creaks open, just enough to allow you to slip into the hallway beyond. (set: _ti to 10) (display:"goto")[[Leave the pit->pit escape2]]<div id="center">$corr</div> You follow the stone hallway, guided by your new vision. It slopes upwards, giving you hope that you will emerge on the surface soon. You place a hand on your racing heart, trying to slow it down. $A[It's okay, Alex, you've got this...] You can still smell the stench of death and *decay* lingering behind you. The pit from which you emerged, the pit that had once consumed you. You feel pretty proud to be walking out of it alive, though you can't shake the feeling that you've left another piece of yourself behind, another threshold has been broken. As your $in[golden eyes] gaze turn the pitch black into silvery gray, you can't help but wonder how far will this path eventually take you. $A[If I can call those wings at will... that could change many things...] All of this time, your $A[sucubus hunger] has brought nothing but trouble. Now you are reaping rewards from it, though you don't yet know at what cost they'll come. Lost in thought, you emerge at the end of the hallway and face a familiar door. $A[So this is where I am...] (set: _ti to 20) (display:"goto")(link-reveal-goto:"Enter the basement","Emerge Basement")[ (set: $pit_escape to 2) ]<div id="center">$base</div> Luckily for you, the metal door has a handle on this side. You push it open and emerge back into the familiar basement. There is no one around, except for the wooden box with the creature inside. You carefully close the door again and straighten your $suit. $A[So far so good...] Now that you think about it, except for the Elder in the tower, no one else knows about your little adventure. You could play it off and just carry on with your day... or you could climb back into the tower and see where that gets you. The thought is tempting. $A[I'd love to see the look on his face...] In either way, it's time to move, unless you want to stay behind and have a chat with the box. (set: _ti to 5) (display:"goto")[[Approach the box->Box2]] (display:"goto")(link-goto:"Leave the basement","gar2")Control for $succ_level and having escaped from the pit $pit_escape 0 - never 1 - done it, not this run 2 - this run $elder_visited 0/1 after you bond with him<div id="center">$T[-TOWER-]</div> (if: (history:)'s last is "tower unlock")[Entering the top of the tower, the Elder is sitting on his throne of skulls, expecting you. His flaming eyes pierce through you as he extends a hand, beckoning you forward. <img src="images/tr/characters/elder.png" width="500" align="right" class="char" > $R['Welcome, my $ElderTitle. What information do you bring?']](else:)[The elder prods you impatiently. <img src="images/tr/characters/elder.png" width="500" align="right" class="char" > $R['Ish there anything else, my $ElderTitle?']] (if: $songFaught)[(display:"talk")[['My Lord, we need a better plan...'->Elder Upgrade]] ](else:)[(unless: $elder_info contains "skulls")[(display:"talk")[['I wanted to ask you about all these skulls'->Elder skulls]] ](if: $elder_fed is 0)[(display:"heart")[['I was actually getting hungry...'->elder feed]] ](if: $conspiracy_lavius is 1 and $elder_info does not contain "Lavius")[(display:"talk")[['I know why Lavius wants to betray you'->Elder Lavius]] ](elseif: $conspiracy_wolf is 1 and $elder_info does not contain "Wolf")[(display:"talk")[['I know why the werewolf is helping Lavius'->Elder Wolf]] ](elseif: $conspiracy_elise is 1 and $elder_info does not contain "Elise")[(display:"talk")[['I know what Elise's motives are'->Elder Elise]] ](elseif: $elder_info contains "Lavius" and "Wolf" and "Elise")[(display:"talk")[['I think we know enough to act'->Edler plan]] ]](display:"bk")[['That's all for now, My Lord'->Elder Leave]]<div id="center">$T[-TOWER-]</div> You push the key in the lock and hear a loud *clang* as the mechanism turns inside. The door creeks open and you slip inside, climbing up the stone staricase. <img src="images/tr/environments/attic_door.png" width="500" align="right" > Despite the complete darkness, you are able to see more this time - the dusty stone steps, as well as the deep scratches in them. It's clear that something very heavy has been clawing its way up and down the tower many times. You trace one of the scratches with your finger - it cuts a few millimeters into the stone. $A[Damn...] Before you know it, you've made your way up to the door at the top. You pause, wondering if you should knock or just barge in. (set: _ti to 4) (display:"goto")[[Enter the room->Confront Elder 1]]<div id="center">$T[-TOWER-]</div> You push the door open and enter the tower. Your golden eyes turn the absolute darkness into a landscape of greys, allowing you to examine the room. <img src="images/tr/characters/elder.png" width="500" align="right" class="char" > The tower's top is a large circular space, dominated by a massive throne of bones and skulls. The dead sockets seem to be staring at you somehow, making you feel uneasy. To your sides, you can see other piles of skulls, arranged in ominous shapes. In the center, there is a large circle with runes etched into the stone. The entire place feels otherworldly and radiates a presence of its own, as if projecting the power of all the slain foes. $R['You agghain...?'] A hiss descends from above, followed by a shadow dropping from the ceiling. The Elder stands in front of you, his glowing red eyes peering down. You take a step forward. You barely measure up to his massive chest. Your gaze turns up, meeting his without flinching. $a['I know you can kill me. I'm here because I'm telling you the truth.'] The vampire remains still. $R['Hhow did you eschhaaape the pit?'] $a['I used my wings to break my fall.'] He raises an eyebrow. $R['You ahre not a normal succubhuss, girl... explain yourself.'] You take a step back, but now it's he who closes the distance, observing you intently. You were not expecting this to take a turn towards your peculiar situation this quickly, but it seems that the Elder is starting to put two and two together. (display:"goto")[[Moan helplessly->Jupiter1]] <div id="center">$T[-BARN-]</div>(set: $milk to false)(set: $glow to false) <div class="two_column_grid" style="--small-col:1fr"><div> Assuming the already familiar position, you can feel your breasts growing and swelling with milk. day meeting the wolf at the reception; -added additional options and flavor for meeting the wolf at the reception; **Sabrina** -added a new Sabrina training: Servitude; -added a new illustration: Servitude; -added brand new art for meeting Sabrina and tentacles; -added new animations for meeting Sabrina scene; -udpated some descriptions and interactions for meeting Sabrina; **Ionut** -polished the fishing for worms event; -added new quest in Chapter 2: Jar of Worms; -added 4 new scenes with Ionut; -added 3 new illustrations for Ionut's scenes; -rebalanced Ionut's relationship progression; **Graveyard** -added new background for a grave; -added new background for an open grave; -added new background for fishing in a grave; -added a new event in Chapter 2: lie on a grave; **Fixes** debt sequence; -fixed an issue that prevented you from getting all outfits in certain cases; <div id="center">0.4.02</div> <hr> **General** -added a new background for the rebirth screen and updated the text; -added a new splash art for Chapter 1; -added a new background for the Hallway level 2 leading to Sabrina and Lavius' rooms; -new Patreon menu to edit character relationships; **Chapter 2** -added new background variations for Ruxandra's tree - splintered and reforged; -you can now visit town more than once; -Sabrina can be found in the laboratory in Chapter 2; -there are now 2 new ways to acquire your wings; **The Temple of Lust** -added a new storyline in chapter 2 (initiated from Sabrina) -added a new background for the temple; -added new interactive illustrated scenes with animations; -added multiple unique conclusions; **The Ritual - Again** -added a new ritual to discover from Sabrina in Chapter 2; -added a new background for the void; -added a new complex illustrated scene with animations; **Body mods** -voodoo piercings added to the patreon body edit menu; -art has been updated for spider and voodoo piercings; -once acquired, special piercings can now be toggled in the "Body" section; <div id="center">0.4.01</div> <hr> **General** -added a new background: Manor Gate; -added a new background: Manor Gate-Open; -updated arrival sequence; -added a new background: (special thanks to Aphrodite); **Chapter2** -added a new task: Full potential; -added a new scene with Felicia and multiple choices/branches; -added new scene with the Elder and multiple branches; -refined multiple transitions and interactions to improve synchronicity; -Alex can now acquire succubus wings; -Chapter 2 can now be completed; -started Chapter 3; **Art** -added new art for looking the tattoo; -added new splash art for Chapter 3; -added new background art for the dungeon; -added a new background for Ruxandra's tree; **Various Improvements** -improved the logic on when you can follow Mihai up the tower in Ch2; -improved picking up meat in the kitchen; -added a special case that avoids breaking the story if you stall for time on your first day in Ch2; -fixed (another) edge case where leaving the Elder's tower after making plans would send you to the box again; -improved the library and gaming room transition nodes to resolve some inconsistencies; <div id="center">0.3.15</div> <hr> ''Hotfix: 0.3.15A'' -fixed a critical issue that got you stuck at unpacking first day; -fixed a bug preventing Naricssa's visited status from resetting on death; -fixed a small trigger that was not sanitizing the sanity changes on cleaning Elise's room (could trigger multiple times if opening inventory and going back, etc) <hr> **General and Engine** -The game has been migrated to a new core version of the engine: Harlowe 3.3.1 and Twine 2.4.1; -the audio engine has been upgraded to HAL 2.3.0 to maintain compatibility; -third party JavaScript has been updated to maintain compatibility; -The ability to export and import saves has been temporarily disabled due to compatibility issues. -Added new game state compression: should reduces the file size of saving after playing for a long time, thus limiting some potential issues with the 6 save slots overflowing the available browser storage; -added a new background to the intro passages of the game; -added a new background for the storage room at the inn; **Narcissa** -added custom notification; -added entries in the journal; -added a new dialogue and challenge; -added a new scene with complex animations; been merged into the main branch; -added the following audio themes: -->Siren's Theme: plays when interacting with Narcissa (in a non-lewd way); -->Siren's Call: Plays during lewd scenes with Narcissa; -->Graveyard's Theme: Plays when you're in the graveyard; -->The Crooked Elm's Theme: Plays while you're exploring the manor (Currently only applied to Introduction area); -->Elise's Theme: out a summer job at a hotel in a remote mountain village in Transylvania. There you met Felicia, a mysterious owner of an antique shop who gave you a special bracelet. Then you died, and the bracelet brought you back to life, and you died again, and again, and again. Every time you changed - sometimes a little, sometimes a lot. Now, your history is a mess, your memories an amalgamation of what was once your reality. Thinking back, you no longer remember your true origin. With every death your existence takes a new, separate shape, one that deviates from the linear path of a human lifetime. You are frightened and excited.") He gestures to the other, giving you a thin smile. <img src="images/tr/characters/mihai2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char"> $Mi['I suppose I should begin by expressing my gratitude. Thank you, Miss Alexandara.'] You blush and akwawkarly look away, not sure how to properly respond to Mihai's formal address. $a['I-it's nothing, I was just doing what any girl... in my position...'] $Mi['Still,'] Mihai continues in a deep voice, $Mi['you should have come to **me** first with the news. Choosing to involve my father has changed the situation entirely and will have far-reaching consequences. Consequences which you cannot fully grasp. Such disobedience would not have come cheaply under other circumstances... but you did save my life.'] Mihai sighs and his tone softens. $Mi['Tell me, why did you do it?'] Ionut arrives and offers you a cup of tea, which you gratefully accept. (set: _ti to 5) (display:"talk")[['Yes, my Lord'->Elder Upgrade Accept]] (display:"talk")[['I was actually trying to avoid this...'->Elder Upgrade Reject]] <div id="center">$T[-TOWER-]</div> $a['I suppose I have little choice at this point... We need to find a way to beat Lavius and stop this whole conspiracy...'] You look up to the Elder with nervous anticipation. It's difficult to guess what would happen now, but it seems like you've come too far to back down now. $R['Goodh answer... you are provingh to be a useful servant, yet aghain... When all this is overh, you will have a place... by my sidhe...'] <img src="images/tr/characters/elder.png" width="500" align="right" class="char" > The Elder rises from his throne and spreads his wings, stretching. His presence fills the room, a mixture of terror, primal power, as well as something else, a sort of godly, or rather un-godly essence. $A[No wonder they worship him....] $R['Come, girl... take my hand...'] His arm is outsretched, long, muscular and crude. Your small palm is like a child in his, delicate and fragile. He takes it without hesitation and in an instant you are pulled towards the vampire as he presses you against his chest. Then he leaps into the air, slowly flapping his wings. Both of you are suspended in the darkness of the tower, the bones and skulls merging into a grim tapestry below. You cling against his torso, instinctively digging your nails in to make sure that you don't fall. But then you realize that you couldn't even if you wanted to, as he can effortlessly keep you even with one arm. You feel a strange mixture of being safe and owned, two sides of a single coin, the token of your servitude to the strange entity. As soon as the initial fear and shock of your flight wears off, you feel something poking between your legs. You can't look down, but you know what it is - and it feels so big. After a moment of hesitation, you know what you must do. (set: _ti to 15) (display:"goto")[[Lower yourself onto him->elder accept2]] <div id="center">$T[-TOWER-]</div> $a['I- uhm... I was actually trying to revert all these changes, not go further...'] The Elder frowns and rises from his chair, menacing. $R['Stupidh whore! Do you not realize you are alerady dhere? Except that you are weakh...'] There is a determination in his eyes that scares you, but you are too transfixed to look away. His hand extends, a massive palm fastening around your throat. He doesn't grip you, not yet, instead just resting his fingers, coarse and strong, his claws caressing your jugular. $R['Do not whorry, my servanth... I will makhe you strongh...'] Like a leaf in the wind, the Elder flips you around and pushes you down. You fall, finding yourself pinned to the floor with nowhere to go, his massive weight on top of you. $R['Now you will understandh...'] You feel something poking between your legs. You can't look down, but you know what it is - and it feels so big. Fighting him feels futile. You whimper. (set: _ti to 3) (display:"goto")[[Go to the library->library3]] (display:"bk")[[Return to the reception->Rec3]] <div id="center">$lib</div> You walk past the gaming room and enter the library. As usual, the place is eerily quiet, with endless rows of shelves basking in dirty rays of sunshine that stream from the tainted windows. You can see specs of dust hanging in the air, as if frozen in time. For a moment, you begin to wonder if Felicia's home has moved again. The library seems back to normal, as much as normal applies to it. But then you take a stroll and begin to feel an all too familiar sensation of distortion. The right turns aren't entirely right and the straight paths warp and wobble as you try to trace them. $A[It seems like the cat is still lurking here somewhere...] (set: _ti to 5) (display:"goto")(link:"Follow the distortions")[ (if: $task_wish is 0)[(goto:"Felicia Shop Ch3")] (else:)[(goto:"Felicia Hub3")] ] (display:"bk")[[Return to the game room->game room3]]<div id="center">$lib</div> <img src="images/tr/characters/felicia_desk.png" width="600" align="right" class="char" id="feliciaPC"><img src="images/tr/characters/felicia2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char" id="feliciaMobile"> You decide to follow your gut and chase down the distortions, navigating twisting corridors and strange turns further and further into the library, until you begin seeing shelves and objects that are out of place, like old watches and dusty gemstones, casually placed among the books. Eventually you arrive at a wooden desk and a smiling cat, who wags her shadow tail gracefully to greet you. $M['Well well, if it isn't my favorite person. I would say my favorite **human**, but judging by your looks, you may have transcended this stage already.'] $a['Hey, I didn't do this on purpose!'] $M['Didn't you? Did those wings sprout on their own?'] You blush and give her an awkward smile, not sure how to answer that. $a['I'm happy to see that you're still here. I was worried...'] $M['Haven't you heard that cats have nine lives?'] she grins and you feel the awkwardness dissipate. It's a subtle but effective way to let you know that the past is the past. $M['But more to the point. I think I've found a solution to your predicament.'] There's a pause as the words sink in. $a['You have?'] $M['Indeed. Unless you're no longer interested?'] Her smile is mischevious now, green eyes studying your reaction. (set: _ti to 10) (display:"talk")[['Tell me what you know'->Felicia spell]]<div id="center">$lib</div> <img src="images/tr/characters/felicia_desk.png" width="600" align="right" class="char" id="feliciaPC"><img src="images/tr/characters/felicia2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char" id="feliciaMobile"> $a['I-I think I will need your help one more time, F,'] you say, a tinge of nervousness in your voice. $M['What is it?'] $a['The plan didn't work,'] you say gloomily, looking at the floor.
